Description: Fragment of rim and neck (mended from four fragments) of Chian pottery trefoil oinochoe; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black (fired brown); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.494 and 1886,0401.497. For parallels, see Boardman 1967 144 fig. 92 no. 589. The Emporio sherd was found in a layer with a date range of 690-550BC.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 224)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 661, no. 185)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0049) (phase 2)
